"All I can say, General," said he with a pleas- ant elegance of expression and intonation that obliged one to listen to each deliberately spok- en word. It was evident that Kutiizov himself 
listened with pleasure to his own voice. "All I can say, General, is that if the matter depend- ed on my personal wishes, the will of His Maj- esty the Emperor Francis would have been ful- filled long ago. I should long ago have joined the archduke. And believe me on my honor that to me personall
